data.name: Extended Credit Card Validation
data.description:
You are required to make a program that determines the validity and card scheme of a credit card. The ideal solution should first check for validity *(Google: Luhn Check)*, returning "Invalid" if it does not pass. After that, it should check for the Card scheme and return the name as a String (as shown in the table). The card scheme patterns are listed below. It is important to note that Minor Schemes are subsections of Major schemes. **Where a single card matches two schemes, only the minor one should be reported.** There are no cases where a card matches two Minor Schemes. ### Major Schemes
Name Starts with Card Length (digits) Example
AMEX 34 or 37 14 - 15 371449635398431
Discover 6011 16 6011111111111117
Mastercard 51 to 55 16 5318273647283745
VISA 4 13 - 19 4012888888881881
### Minor Schemes
Name Starts with Card Length (digits) Example
Dankort 5019 16 5019717010103742
Unionpay 62 or 88 16 - 19 6222821234560017
UATP 1 15 108046752964787
Maestro 50, 56 - 58, 63, 67 12 - 19 6759000000000018
Visa Electron 4026, 417500, 4405, 4508, 4844, 4913, 4917 16 - 19 4917300800000000
### Error cases * All cards that fail a Luhn check should return "Invalid" * 12345678910 --> Output: "Invalid" * All cards that pass a Luhn check but cannot whose card scheme cannot be determined should return "Unknown" * 210007296874267 --> Output: "Unknown"
